chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Michael Hintz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to contact Probation Office by 4pm today

11:27 AM Defendant Robert Michael Hintz in court.  Attorney Mark J Gumz in court for Robert Michael Hintz.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Juech states plea agreement to Count 1.  Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Gumz waives the request for the PSI.  State has complied with victim notification requirements. 
Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Count 1:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
*30 days in the Marquette County Jail; stayed for use of the Agent
*Court Costs = $268.00
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00
*No contact with Witness 1 or her residence
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol 
*Random drug and alcohol screens as recommended by the Agent
*Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
Cash bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it
Credit to be determined by stipulation
Defendant is to contact the Probation office in Portage, WI by 4:00pm today 
**Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm. 

Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2022 at 11:15 am.

9:59 AM Defendant Robert Michael Hintz not in court.  Attorney Mark J Gumz in court for Robert Michael Hintz.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz was unable to reach his client this morning; asks if a warrant is issued that it be stayed until the end of the day.  Atty Juech requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue; stayed until 4:00pm today

Court questions if they should reset due to the defendant's internet issues.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Reset

Status hearing on May 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Atty Gumz has received the Information and waives it's reading.  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

03:30 PM Defendant Robert Michael Hintz appeared by video means with Attorney Mark J Gumz. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states defendant will waive right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant who has no objection to appearing by video today.  Court questions defendant on his waiver of preliminary hearing and finds it is being waived freely, voluntarily & intelligently.    BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.  Status hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
